issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a new MobileAppProject
2. Create a new sql model
3. Neither can find the model i created nor any resource files in the main project(views and other js files)

h3. Actual Result
Can see only 3 files namely changelog ,license , manifest and a empty resource folder

h3. Expected Result
Want to see all the resource file and project structure. Also newly created model as well
fields.summary: Default Alloy projects not showing any resource files

comments.body: Hello, I just tested it. I can create a new Alloy project and a sql model inside it. Please see the attachment. I would suggest you run " appc setup" and install Alloy again. Thanks.

Thanks for the replies.

This is showing JDK not installed. Actually i have updated my path variable and also the JAVA_HOME variable as well to jdk 32 bit and jre 32bit.

JAVA_HOME: C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_80\bin

in path variable bewlow stuff has been added. Also i have restarted my machine many times 
C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_80\bin;C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre7\bin 

After all these i got the log (commented above) for "appc info". Still its showing java_home/jdk not installed. So strange!

@sharif Abudarda

C:\Users\i312016>appc setup
Finding latest version ...5.2.2 OK
Version 5.2.2 already installed.
An uncaught exception was thrown!
Cannot find module 'typechecker'
Cannot find module 'typechecker'

Yes i installed 32bit jdk only, please check the location i have shared C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_80\bin. 

Alloy version cannot be determined as am geeting a message in cmd :
 'alloy' is not a recogonized as an internal or eternal command

Android latest i have installed now.

Hello, Looks like you have a problem in configuration. I would suggest you reinstall your environment. Run the below command as follows

rm -rf ~/.appcelerator
rm -rf ~/.titanium
npm uninstall -g titanium
npm uninstall -g alloy
npm uninstall -g appcelerator

After the successful run

npm install -g appcelerator
appc use latest
appc setup
npm install -g alloy 

Now, Check the alloy have installed as

alloy -v

Make sure you run in administrative command prompt.

Regards,
Sharif.
